sentences.english: I think my brother has finally kicked the gambling habit.
sentences.chinese: 我想我哥哥算是绝对改掉牌赌的恶习啦。

sentences.english: Tie to the post of Unconcern the goats of Vice and Virtue.
sentences.chinese: 把恶习与美德两头山羊绑在漫不经心的柱子上。

sentences.english: In a big hug east Juan home had big li habit very worried.
sentences.chinese: 拥东在大娟家的恶习表现让大丽很担忧。

sentences.english: He was addicted to all sorts of vice.
The boss has a nasty habit of baiting defenceless subordinates.
sentences.chinese: 这位老板有一个作弄孤立无助的下级的恶习。

sentences.english: Jane said she would take her husband back if he promised to give up bad habits.
sentences.chinese: 简说如果她丈夫保证戒除恶习，她就让他回来。

sentences.english: The vice-adviser advised the reviser to devise a device forgetting rid of vice.
sentences.chinese: 代办参谋倡议校正者想出一个铲除恶习的计谋。

sentences.english: Affirm that no matter what you will not backslide into your old bad habit patterns.
sentences.chinese: 申明无论怎样你不会倒退到旧恶习贵模式。

sentences.english: Or have you all old vices spent, and now would find out others?
sentences.chinese: 还是你玩腻了所有旧的恶习，又来寻找新的？

sentences.english: Constant indulgence in bad habits brought about his ruin.
sentences.chinese: 经常沉溺于恶习导致了他的毁灭。

sentences.english: The demon of greed ruined the miser's happiness.
sentences.chinese: 贪得无厌的恶习毁掉了那个守财奴的幸福。

sentences.english: Economic envy, once seen as a European vice, is now rife.
sentences.chinese: 曾经被看做欧式恶习的经济嫉妒，如今却很盛行。

sentences.english: The vice-agent proposed the reviser to devise a computer device for getting rid of vice.
sentences.chinese: 代理照料建议校订者想出一个废除恶习的计谋。

sentences.english: Prejudices are the real robbers; vices are the real murderers.
sentences.chinese: 偏见便是盗贼，恶习便是杀人犯。

sentences.english: From now, I will be a student who is preparing for national college entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 从今起，我将戒除所有恶习，一心一意，考大学。

sentences.english: Three experts tell WebMD how to spot those hefty habits - and change them!
sentences.chinese: 专家告诉我们如何发现这些恶习，并且将之改正。

definition: to love ease and comfort and hate work (idiom)
heavy drinking/to get drunk/to drink to excess
to quit/to give up (a bad habit)
happy to partake but not prepared to do any work (idiom)/all take and no give
old habits are hard to change (idiom)
lit. not to change, despite repeated admonition/incorrigible/unrepentant
